Articles.Content:
I've had a couple of designs now, that have the OKTO on them, but SAS stays greyed out and wont enable. other very simular designs will allow me to enable SAS no problem.

there's no lack of power or anything like that, can't figure out why it's happening.

If you are absolutely sure that they have electricity, send logs.

Have you tried right clicking the core and set.to control from here?

Also, does this happen only during reentry?

yeah I tried rightclicking and control here.

I've just figured out that the "t" hotkey works, though clicking on it does not. strange. something is blocking the click but not the key?

Huh. I never knew clicking worked, and I've played the game for 5 years.

No clue what's wrong. Is it really only the OKTO or is the OKTO just the only probe core you've used recently?
I can't reproduce your problem. Clicking on the SAS button for a probe with an OKTO is working for me.

17 minutes ago, bewing said:

I can't reproduce your problem. Clicking on the SAS button for a probe with an OKTO is working for me.

Hence the "Sometimes" idk, I recently just built a simple rocket to complete a contract and had the problem, tried a bunch of different things to try get it to work but it's not clicking at all on probes and remote items now. possibly it's mod related? also, I'm running the linux version which may be another point of difference. 

Normal ships seem fine.

Edited July 30, 2018 by se5a
Are you in signal range of the KSC?
yes, or I'd be unable to maneuver, and I'd get a big yellow warning about the connection.
What mods do you have? Anyway, ycan you still toggle with the t button?

Too many mods.

ones that might affect it off the top of my head would be:

MechJeb

Remote Tech

Atmosphere Autopilot

I know. I'm very late, but for others who is looking for the answer is that. Uncheck a chekbox from advanced difficulty settings that is called "Enable comm links weakiening while going through Atmospheric Plasma". if you turn it off, then your connection won't disappear, when entering atmosphere.

 

Thank me later

On 3/31/2021 at 9:52 AM, ShuttlePilot said:

I know. I'm very late, but for others who is looking for the answer is that. Uncheck a chekbox from advanced difficulty settings that is called "Enable comm links weakiening while going through Atmospheric Plasma". if you turn it off, then your connection won't disappear, when entering atmosphere.

 

Thank me later

Plasma blackout doesn’t stop you using SAS modes unless you’ve also selected “require signal for control”. You can still use SAS with partial control as far as I know.

34 minutes ago, jimmymcgoochie said:

Plasma blackout doesn’t stop you using SAS modes unless you’ve also selected “require signal for control”. You can still use SAS with partial control as far as I know.

Not really, as I'm mostly playing with this setting ON and it DOES stop you from using SAS. Even with partial control it just won't let SAS. It only lets you throttle Max or 0 and control robotic parts and airbrakes. But SAS and other universal features are disabled with these settings.
